title: List directory contents
description: List files and directories in the current path.

examples.title: List files in the current directory
examples.explanation: Shows non-hidden files and directories in the current location.

examples.title: Show detailed information
examples.explanation: Displays permissions, owner, size and modification time.

examples.title: List all files including hidden
examples.explanation: Adds hidden files (starting with a dot) to the output.

title: Change directory
description: Change the current working directory.

examples.title: Move into a directory
examples.explanation: Makes /var/log the current working directory.

examples.title: Go to the home directory
examples.explanation: Jumps to the current user's home directory.

examples.title: Go back to the previous directory
examples.explanation: Toggles between the current and previous directory.

title: Search text using patterns
description: Search for lines matching a pattern in files or input.

examples.title: Search for a word in a file
examples.explanation: Shows all lines in syslog that contain the word 'error'.

examples.title: Case-insensitive search
examples.explanation: Matches 'warning', 'Warning', 'WARNING', etc.

examples.title: Recursive search in a directory
examples.explanation: Searches 'TODO' in all files under the current directory.

title: Control systemd services
description: Start, stop, enable, disable and inspect systemd services.

examples.title: Check the status of a service
examples.explanation: Shows whether nginx is running, with logs and status info.

examples.title: Restart a service
examples.explanation: Restarts the SSH daemon and applies configuration changes.

examples.title: Enable a service at boot
examples.explanation: Configures Docker to start automatically after reboot.

title: Configure IPv4 packet filtering rules
description: Low-level firewall rule management for Linux networking.

examples.title: List all rules with line numbers
examples.explanation: Shows all rules in filter table with numeric output.

examples.title: Allow incoming SSH from a specific IP
examples.explanation: Adds a rule to accept SSH only from 203.0.113.10.

examples.title: Drop all incoming traffic by default
examples.explanation: Changes the default policy for INPUT chain to drop packets.

title: Print working directory
description: Display the full path of the current working directory.

examples.title: Show current directory path
examples.explanation: Prints the absolute path of your current location in the filesystem.

title: Create directories
description: Create one or more new directories.

examples.title: Create a single directory
examples.explanation: Creates a directory named 'projects' in the current location.

examples.title: Create nested directories
examples.explanation: Creates the full path, including any missing parent directories.

title: Remove empty directories
description: Remove one or more empty directories.

examples.title: Remove an empty directory
examples.explanation: Deletes the directory 'old_logs' if it is empty.

title: Remove files or directories
description: Delete files or directories permanently.

examples.title: Remove a single file
examples.explanation: Deletes file.txt without moving it to a recycle bin.

examples.title: Recursively remove a directory
examples.explanation: Deletes 'old_backup' and all its contents without confirmation.

title: Copy files and directories
description: Copy files or directories to another location.

examples.title: Copy a file
examples.explanation: Creates a copy of file.txt named backup.txt.

examples.title: Copy directories recursively
examples.explanation: Copies the entire images directory into backup_images.

title: Move or rename files
description: Move files or directories or rename them.

examples.title: Rename a file
examples.explanation: Changes the name of oldname.txt to newname.txt.

examples.title: Move a file to another directory
examples.explanation: Moves report.pdf into the Documents directory.

title: Create or update files
description: Create empty files or update file timestamps.

examples.title: Create an empty file
examples.explanation: Creates notes.txt if it does not exist.

examples.title: Update file modification time
examples.explanation: Updates the modification time of script.sh to now.

title: Concatenate and display files
description: Display file contents or concatenate multiple files.

examples.title: Show a file's contents
examples.explanation: Prints file.txt to standard output.

examples.title: Combine two files
examples.explanation: Merges part1.txt and part2.txt into full.txt.

title: View text one screen at a time
description: Interactively view large text files page by page.

examples.title: View a log file
examples.explanation: Opens syslog in a scrollable pager.

examples.title: View output of another command
examples.explanation: Pipes kernel messages into less for easier navigation.

title: Simple pager for text
description: Display text one screenful at a time.

examples.title: View a file with more
examples.explanation: Shows file.txt screen by screen.

title: Show beginning of files
description: Display the first lines of a file.

examples.title: Show first 10 lines
examples.explanation: Displays the first 10 lines of file.txt.

examples.title: Show first 50 lines
examples.explanation: Displays the first 50 lines.

title: Show end of files
description: Display the last lines of a file.

examples.title: Show last 10 lines
examples.explanation: Displays the final 10 lines of file.txt.

examples.title: Follow a growing log file
examples.explanation: Shows new lines as they are appended to syslog.

title: Search for files in a directory hierarchy
description: Search for files and directories matching conditions.

examples.title: Find files by name
examples.explanation: Lists all .log files under the current directory.

examples.title: Find and delete old files
examples.explanation: Deletes regular files in /tmp older than 7 days.

title: Quickly find files by name
description: Search a prebuilt database to quickly find files.

examples.title: Find all paths containing 'bashrc'
examples.explanation: Lists cached locations of files with 'bashrc' in their path.

title: Update locate database
description: Update the file name database used by locate.

examples.title: Refresh locate index
examples.explanation: Rebuilds the locate database for accurate searches.

title: Show executable location
description: Display the full path of shell commands.

examples.title: Find where bash is installed
examples.explanation: Shows the path of the bash executable in $PATH.

title: Locate binary, source, and man page files
description: Find the binary, source, and manual files for a command.

examples.title: Locate ls binary and man page
examples.explanation: Shows the path to ls and related documentation.

title: Display manual pages
description: View the system reference manual for commands.

examples.title: Read ls manual
examples.explanation: Opens the manual page for the ls command.

title: Read Info documentation
description: Display detailed info documents for commands and programs.

examples.title: Show coreutils info
examples.explanation: Opens the GNU coreutils info manual.

title: Change file permissions
description: Modify read, write, and execute permissions on files and directories.

examples.title: Make a script executable
examples.explanation: Adds execute permission for all users on script.sh.

examples.title: Set permissions using octal
examples.explanation: Owner can read/write, group can read, others have no access.

title: Change file owner and group
description: Change the owning user and/or group of files and directories.

examples.title: Change file owner
examples.explanation: Makes alice the owner of report.txt.

examples.title: Change owner and group recursively
examples.explanation: Changes owner and group of /var/www and its contents.

title: Change group ownership
description: Change the group associated with files and directories.

examples.title: Change group of a directory
examples.explanation: Sets the group owner of the project directory to developers.

title: Run a command as another user
description: Execute a command with elevated privileges (usually root).

examples.title: Edit a root-owned file
examples.explanation: Opens /etc/hosts in nano with root permissions.

title: Switch user
description: Switch to another user account, optionally with a login shell.

examples.title: Switch to root user
examples.explanation: Switches to the root account with login environment.

title: Report process status
description: List running processes and their details.

examples.title: Show processes for current terminal
examples.explanation: Lists processes started from the current shell.

examples.title: Show all processes with full format
examples.explanation: Displays all processes with user, CPU, memory, and more.

title: Interactive process viewer
description: Display real-time information about running processes.

examples.title: Run top
examples.explanation: Shows CPU, memory usage, and active processes interactively.

title: Enhanced interactive process viewer
description: Colorful, interactive process viewer with easier controls.

examples.title: Start htop
examples.explanation: Launches htop with CPU, memory graphs and interactive controls.

title: Send signal to a process
description: Send signals like TERM or KILL to processes by PID.

examples.title: Terminate a process
examples.explanation: Sends SIGTERM to process with PID 1234.

examples.title: Force kill a process
examples.explanation: Sends SIGKILL to immediately end the process.

title: Kill processes by name
description: Send signals to all processes matching a given name.

examples.title: Kill all firefox processes
examples.explanation: Sends SIGTERM to every process named firefox.

title: Report file system disk space usage
description: Show available and used space on mounted filesystems.

examples.title: Human-readable disk usage
examples.explanation: Displays disk sizes in KB/MB/GB units.

title: Estimate file space usage
description: Summarize disk usage of files and directories.

examples.title: Show size of current directory
examples.explanation: Displays the total size of the current directory.

examples.title: Show sizes of subdirectories
examples.explanation: Shows sizes of each item in the current directory.

title: Display memory usage
description: Show total, used, and free system memory.

examples.title: Human-readable memory info
examples.explanation: Displays memory usage in human-readable units.

title: Print system information
description: Display basic system and kernel information.

examples.title: Show kernel name
examples.explanation: Prints the operating system name.

examples.title: Show detailed system info
examples.explanation: Shows kernel name, version, machine, and more.

title: Show or set system hostname
description: Display or change the system's network hostname.

examples.title: Show hostname
examples.explanation: Prints the current hostname.

title: Display or set system date and time
description: Show current date and time or set them.

examples.title: Show current date and time
examples.explanation: Prints the local date and time.

examples.title: Custom formatted date
examples.explanation: Shows date and time in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format.

title: Show current username
description: Print the effective user ID's username.

examples.title: Check current user
examples.explanation: Displays the username associated with the current shell.

title: Show logged-in users
description: Display who is logged into the system.

examples.title: List users
examples.explanation: Shows users logged in and their terminals.

title: Show logged-in users and activity
description: Display who is logged on and what they are doing.

examples.title: Show system activity
examples.explanation: Displays users, their idle time, and CPU usage.

title: Print user identity
description: Show user and group IDs and memberships.

examples.title: Show current user IDs
examples.explanation: Displays UID, GID, and group memberships.

title: Show or set environment variables
description: Display the environment or run a command with modified environment.

examples.title: List environment variables
examples.explanation: Prints all environment variables for the current shell.

title: Display a line of text
description: Print the given arguments to standard output.

examples.title: Print a message
examples.explanation: Outputs the text to the terminal.

examples.title: Show value of an environment variable
examples.explanation: Prints the path of the user's home directory.

title: Command history
description: Display or manipulate the shell command history.

examples.title: Show recent commands
examples.explanation: Lists previously executed commands.

title: Create command aliases
description: Define or display aliases for commands.

examples.title: Create a simple alias
examples.explanation: Defines ll as a shortcut for ls -la.

title: Remove command aliases
description: Remove previously defined aliases.

examples.title: Remove ll alias
examples.explanation: Deletes the alias named ll.

title: Check network connectivity
description: Send ICMP echo requests to test reachability of a host.

examples.title: Ping a host
examples.explanation: Continuously sends packets to google.com until interrupted.

examples.title: Send a limited number of pings
examples.explanation: Sends 4 ICMP echo requests to 8.8.8.8.

title: Trace network path
description: Show the route packets take to reach a network host.

examples.title: Trace route to a domain
examples.explanation: Displays each hop on the path to example.com.

title: Secure shell remote login
description: Connect securely to a remote machine over SSH.

examples.title: Connect to a server
examples.explanation: Opens an interactive shell on the remote server as user.

examples.title: Use a specific key file
examples.explanation: Authenticates with the specified private key.

title: Secure copy over SSH
description: Copy files between hosts over SSH.

examples.title: Copy from local to remote
examples.explanation: Uploads file.txt to /tmp on the remote server.

examples.title: Copy from remote to local
examples.explanation: Downloads syslog to the current directory.

title: Efficient file synchronization
description: Synchronize files and directories locally or over SSH.

examples.title: Sync a local directory to remote
examples.explanation: Synchronizes project directory to the remote server with compression and verbose output.

examples.title: Delete removed files on target
examples.explanation: Makes dest/ mirror src/, deleting files not present in src/.

title: Non-interactive network downloader
description: Download files from the web via HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP.

examples.title: Download a file
examples.explanation: Saves file.zip in the current directory.

title: Transfer data from or to a server
description: Send HTTP requests or transfer data using many protocols.

examples.title: Fetch a webpage
examples.explanation: Outputs the HTML content of the webpage.

examples.title: Send a POST request with JSON
examples.explanation: Sends JSON data to an API endpoint.

title: DNS lookup
description: Query DNS servers for information about hostnames.

examples.title: Lookup A records
examples.explanation: Retrieves IPv4 address records for example.com.

examples.title: Query DNS server directly
examples.explanation: Uses Google DNS to resolve example.com.

title: Configure network interfaces (legacy)
description: View or configure network interfaces (superseded by ip on many systems).

examples.title: Show all interfaces
examples.explanation: Displays information about all active network interfaces.

title: Show and manipulate routing, devices, and tunnels
description: Modern tool for configuring IP addresses and network interfaces.

examples.title: Show addresses
examples.explanation: Lists IP addresses assigned to interfaces.

examples.title: Show routing table
examples.explanation: Displays kernel routing table.

title: View socket statistics
description: Dump socket statistics, similar to netstat but faster.

examples.title: Show listening TCP ports
examples.explanation: Displays listening TCP sockets with numeric addresses.

title: Archive files
description: Create or extract tar archive files.

examples.title: Create a tar.gz archive
examples.explanation: Archives the project directory with gzip compression.

examples.title: Extract an archive
examples.explanation: Extracts files from backup.tar.gz into current directory.

title: Compress files
description: Compress or decompress files using the gzip format.

examples.title: Compress a file
examples.explanation: Replaces file.txt with a compressed file.txt.gz.

title: Decompress gzip files
description: Decompress files compressed with gzip.

examples.title: Decompress a gzip file
examples.explanation: Restores the original file.txt.

title: Package and compress files into zip archive
description: Create ZIP archives from files and directories.

examples.title: Create a zip archive
examples.explanation: Compresses the project directory into project.zip.

title: Extract zip archives
description: List or extract files from ZIP archives.

examples.title: Extract a zip file
examples.explanation: Extracts files from project.zip into current directory.

title: Simple text editor
description: User-friendly terminal text editor.

examples.title: Edit a configuration file
examples.explanation: Opens /etc/fstab for editing with nano.

title: Powerful text editor
description: Modal text editor for advanced editing workflows.

examples.title: Edit a file
examples.explanation: Opens main.c in the vim editor.

title: Stream editor
description: Filter and transform text using editing commands.

examples.title: Replace text in a file
examples.explanation: Replaces all occurrences of 'foo' with 'bar' in file.txt.

title: Pattern scanning and processing language
description: Powerful text processing tool for columns and records.

examples.title: Print the first column
examples.explanation: Outputs the first whitespace-separated field of each line.

title: Sort lines of text files
description: Sort lines in alphabetical or numerical order.

examples.title: Alphabetically sort a file
examples.explanation: Outputs names.txt with lines in sorted order.

examples.title: Sort numerically in reverse
examples.explanation: Sorts numbers from largest to smallest.

title: Report or omit repeated lines
description: Filter or count repeated lines in sorted input.

examples.title: Remove duplicate lines
examples.explanation: Outputs unique lines from names.txt.

examples.title: Count occurrences
examples.explanation: Shows how many times each line appears.

title: Remove sections from lines
description: Extract specific columns or character ranges from each line.

examples.title: Extract first field
examples.explanation: Prints the first comma-separated column of data.csv.

title: Translate or delete characters
description: Replace or remove specific characters from input.

examples.title: Convert lowercase to uppercase
examples.explanation: Outputs HELLO.

title: Read from standard input and write to files and standard output
description: Split command output to both terminal and files.

examples.title: Save and display output
examples.explanation: Shows ls output and writes it to listing.txt.

title: Build and execute command lines from standard input
description: Convert input into arguments for another command.

examples.title: Delete files listed from find
examples.explanation: Removes all .tmp files found under the current directory.

title: Compare files line by line
description: Show differences between two files or directories.

examples.title: Compare two config files
examples.explanation: Shows line-by-line differences between the two files.

title: Apply a diff file to original files
description: Apply changes described by a diff file.

examples.title: Patch source code
examples.explanation: Applies changes from fix-bug.patch to files in the current directory.

title: Create links between files
description: Create hard or symbolic links.

examples.title: Create a symbolic link
examples.explanation: Creates a symlink named logs pointing to /var/log.

title: List block devices
description: Show information about block devices such as disks and partitions.

examples.title: Show block device tree
examples.explanation: Lists disks, partitions, and mount points.

title: Mount a filesystem
description: Attach a filesystem to the directory tree.

examples.title: Mount a USB drive
examples.explanation: Mounts /dev/sdb1 at /mnt/usb.

title: Unmount a filesystem
description: Detach a filesystem from the directory tree.

examples.title: Unmount a USB drive
examples.explanation: Safely unmounts the filesystem at /mnt/usb.

title: Disk partitioning tool
description: Create and manipulate partition tables on disks.

examples.title: Edit partitions on a disk
examples.explanation: Opens an interactive partition editor for /dev/sda.

title: Query the systemd journal
description: View and filter logs collected by systemd-journald.

examples.title: View recent boot logs
examples.explanation: Shows messages from the current boot.

examples.title: Follow logs for a unit
examples.explanation: Tails log entries for the nginx service.

title: Print kernel ring buffer
description: Show kernel messages, often useful for debugging hardware issues.

examples.title: View recent kernel messages
examples.explanation: Shows the latest lines from the kernel log.

title: Restart the system
description: Reboot the operating system.

examples.title: Reboot immediately
examples.explanation: Instructs the system to restart.

title: Halt or power off the system
description: Schedule a shutdown or reboot.

examples.title: Power off immediately
examples.explanation: Shuts down the machine right away.

examples.title: Reboot in 5 minutes
examples.explanation: Schedules a reboot in five minutes.

title: Schedule periodic jobs
description: Install, edit, or list cron tables used to schedule commands.

examples.title: Edit current user's cron jobs
examples.explanation: Opens the user's crontab in an editor.

title: Schedule a one-time job
description: Schedule a command to be run at a particular time.

examples.title: Run a command at 10 PM
examples.explanation: Schedules backup.sh to run at 10 PM today.

title: Create a new user
description: Create a new user account.

examples.title: Add a user with home directory
examples.explanation: Creates user alice with a home directory.

title: Modify a user account
description: Change properties of an existing user.

examples.title: Add user to a group
examples.explanation: Adds alice to the sudo group.

title: Delete a user account
description: Remove a user from the system.

examples.title: Delete a user and home directory
examples.explanation: Removes alice and their home directory.

title: Change user password
description: Update user account passwords.

examples.title: Change your own password
examples.explanation: Prompts for the current and new password.

title: Package manager (Debian/Ubuntu)
description: Install, update, and remove software packages.

examples.title: Update package index
examples.explanation: Refreshes the list of available packages.

examples.title: Install a package
examples.explanation: Installs the nginx web server.

title: Package manager (RHEL/CentOS legacy)
description: Install, update, and remove packages on RPM-based systems.

examples.title: Install a package
examples.explanation: Installs the Apache HTTP server.

title: Modern package manager (RHEL/Fedora)
description: Next-generation package manager for RPM-based systems.

examples.title: Update all packages
examples.explanation: Upgrades all installed packages.

title: Package manager (Arch Linux)
description: Install, update, and remove packages on Arch-based systems.

examples.title: Install a package
examples.explanation: Installs the nginx package on Arch Linux.
